bullets: A glimpse into the past
slide_1.title: History Project

bullets: Alice - Research Lead
Bob - Data Analyst

Dave - Visual Designer
Eve - Presenter
slide_2.title: Our Team

bullets: The Industrial Revolution began in the late 18th century and dramatically altered the course of history by shifting societies from agrarian economies to industrial powerhouses. This project delves into how this shift impacted various aspects of human life.

We explore the causes behind the revolution, such as technological innovation and availability of natural resources, and examine the consequences it had on labor, urbanization, and global trade dynamics.
slide_3.title: Background

bullets: Harsh factory conditions and child labor were rampant.
Pollution rose sharply due to unregulated emissions, and social inequality increased as factory owners grew richer while workers remained underpaid and overworked.
Rural communities declined as cities expanded, and skilled labor saw a drop in demand due to machine automation.
slide_4.title: Problems

bullets: Understand the historical impact of the Industrial Revolution.
Analyze social and economic transformations caused by mechanization, and explore the shift from rural to urban societies during this era.
Provide an insight into lessons learned from history that influence current industrial and technological trends.

slide_6.title: Lorem

bullets: Statistical records show exponential growth in manufacturing output between 1760 and 1840. Population densities increased in urban zones while rural populations declined. Employment shifted from agriculture to industry, with female and child labor contributing significantly.
slide_7.title: Data Analysis

bullets: Mass production became feasible
Global trade expanded rapidly, fueling colonization and economic dominance
Education and reforms gained traction to improve worker conditions and reduce inequality
Technological advancements like the steam engine revolutionized transport and commerce
slide_8.title: Result

bullets: The Industrial Revolution was a turning point

It reshaped economies and societies across continents, fostering innovation but also causing deep social challenges. Understanding this transformation provides valuable context for today’s digital and industrial evolution.
slide_9.title: Conclusion

bullets: References include academic journals, historical databases, and museum archives providing credible information about the Industrial Revolution’s timeline, effects, and long-term implications.
slide_10.title: Documentation

slide_11.title: Any questions or thoughts you’d like to share?
